sentences:
Fedor Ozep or Fyodor Otsep ( , Fyodor Aleksandrovich Otsep ; February 9 , 1895 – June 20 , 1949 ) was a Russian - American film director and screenwriter , born in Moscow .
An important early writer on film and film theory , he served as dramaturge for the Mezhrabpomfilm - Rus company and wrote a number of films for directors such as V.I. 
During the production of The Living Corpse in Germany , he decided to remain and worked throughout Europe during the 1930s , enjoying international acclaim for films including The Murderer Dimitri Karamazov and Amok .
With the advent of World War II he moved to Hollywood but was unable to establish a career there , directing only one film .
His last two films were made in Canada .
He died of a heart attack in Los Angeles in 1949 .
